problem.fixMessage: Please use an http://bad.ex.Lang supported by this BPEL processor.
problem.message: expressionLanguage attribute refers to an unsupported language URI http://bad.ex.Lang
problem.ruleDescription: Checks the expression language for support in the BPEL model

problem.fixMessage: Please use an http://bad.query.Language supported by this BPEL processor.
problem.message: queryLanguage attribute refers to an unsupported language URI http://bad.query.Language
problem.ruleDescription: Checks the query language for support in the BPEL model

problem.fixMessage: A <receive> or <pick> with createInstance set to "true" must be present.
problem.message: There is no start activity in process "Simple"
problem.ruleDescription: Verifies that a start activity has been found in the process

problem.context.name: mustUnderstand
problem.fixMessage: Make sure that the attribute "mustUnderstand" is specified.
problem.message: Attribute "mustUnderstand" is not set on this <bpws:extension> node.

problem.context.name: mustUnderstand
problem.fixMessage: Make sure that "mustUnderstand" is set to one of the values from "no", "yes"
problem.message: "mustUnderstand" is set to "yesxx" on this <bpws:extension> node but it can only be set to "no", "yes"

problem.fixMessage: Remove the dependency on extension "http://foobar/extension/4"
problem.message: Extension "http://foobar/extension/4" is not supported by this implementation.
problem.ruleDescription: Mandatory extensions must be understood

problem.message: !!BPELC_PROPERTY__UNSET! [0=prop:property,1=type,2=element,3=0,4={4},5={5}]
problem.ruleDescription: Either the type or element attributes MUST be present but not both.

problem.fixMessage: Make sure that value "xsd:integer" is resolvable (check imports, value of "type").
problem.message: "type" is set to "xsd:integer" on this <prop:property> but it cannot be resolved (check value of "type", imports, WSDLs or XSDs).

problem.fixMessage: Change the import statement namespace.
problem.message: The import namespace http://eclipse.org/bpel/badNS and the imported document target namespace http://eclipse.org/bpel/sampleArtifacts do not match.
problem.ruleDescription: Imported namespace, if set, must match

problem.fixMessage: Remove the namespace attribute from the import statement.
problem.message: The targetNamespace http://eclipse.org/bpel/sampleArtifacts of the imported document is not the default namespace.
problem.ruleDescription: When import has no namespace, the targetNamespace must be empty.

problem.fixMessage: Make sure that the attribute "importType" is specified.
problem.message: Attribute "importType" is not set on this <bpws:import> node.

problem.fixMessage: WSDL and XSD imports are allowed in BPEL 2.0, others are implementation dependent.
problem.message: The importType of http://bad.import.type is not defined in BPEL 2.0 and is not understood by this implementation.
problem.ruleDescription: Check the import type. BPEL 2.0 currently supports WSDL and XSD import types.

problem.context.name: name
problem.fixMessage: You must change the name of bpws:partnerLink "client" to something else.
problem.message: <bpws:partnerLink> name "client" is already defined in this scope/process.
problem.ruleDescription: Checks for duplicate partner link name

problem.fixMessage: You must specify either "myRole" or "partnerRole" for the <{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/process/executable}partnerLink> "noRoles"
problem.message: {http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/process/executable}partnerLink "noRoles" must have "myRole" and/or "partnerRole" set.
problem.ruleDescription: myRole or partnerRole (or both) must be set

problem.fixMessage: You must remove "initializePartnerRole" from this <bpws:partnerLink>.
problem.message: The "initializePartnerRole" cannot be used on <bpws:partnerLink> that does not have partnerRole defined.
problem.ruleDescription: Check if initializePartnerRole is set on the partnerLink if partnerRole is set (or not).

problem.fixMessage: Remove the overloaded operation "start2" in portType "OverloadedPT".
problem.message: partnerLink "overloadedPL" uses portType "OverloadedPT" (via partnerLinkType "{http://eclipse.org/bpel/sample}Overloaded") which has an overloaded operation "start2".
problem.ruleDescription: Check for overloaded operation names in port types

problem.fixMessage: Notification operations cannot be used in BPEL partnerLinkTypes.
problem.message: Notification operation "operationStart" in portType "NotificationPT" (via partnerLinkType "{http://eclipse.org/bpel/sample}RejectThis") cannot be used in a BPEL process.
problem.ruleDescription: Check solicit-response or notification port types

problem.fixMessage: Solicit-response operations cannot be used in BPEL partnerLinkTypes.
problem.message: Solicit-response operation "operationStart" in portType "SolicityResponsePT" cannot be used in a BPEL process.
problem.ruleDescription: Check solicit-response or notification port types

problem.fixMessage: The <{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/plnktype}partnerLinkType> must define a role "ListenerResonder".
problem.message: <{http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/plnktype}partnerLinkType> does not have a role "ListenerResonder" defined.

problem.fixMessage: Notification operations cannot be used in BPEL partnerLinkTypes.
problem.message: Notification operation "operationStart" in portType "NotificationPT" (via partnerLinkType "{http://eclipse.org/bpel/sample}RejectThis") cannot be used in a BPEL process.
problem.ruleDescription: Check solicit-response or notification port types

problem.fixMessage: Solicit-response operations cannot be used in BPEL partnerLinkTypes.
problem.message: Solicit-response operation "operationStart" in portType "SolicityResponsePT" cannot be used in a BPEL process.
problem.ruleDescription: Check solicit-response or notification port types

problem.context.name: name
problem.fixMessage: You must change the name of bpws:variable "aDuplicateName" to something else.
problem.message: <bpws:variable> name "aDuplicateName" is already defined in this scope/process.
problem.ruleDescription: Checks for duplicate variable name

problem.context.name: messageType

problem.context.name: name
problem.fixMessage: Remove the period (.) character from variable name.

problem.ruleDescription: Checks that variable NCName further does not contain a period (.) in the name.

problem.context.name: type
problem.fixMessage: Define the type of the variable "bad.Name"
problem.message: Variable "bad.Name" must be have either messageType,element, or type defined.

problem.fixMessage: Register the validator for this expression language and try again.
problem.message: The expression in <bpws:from> cannot be checked - no expression validator has been registered for language http://bad.ex.Lang.
problem.ruleDescription: Checks the actual expression using the expression language validator.

problem.fixMessage: Simple types ought to be compatible.
problem.message: The from-spec of simple type "<xs:simpleType "boolean">" is not compatible with to-spec of simple type "<xs:simpleType "integer">" - a BPEL runtime may provide an implicit conversion.
problem.ruleDescription: From and to spec must have compatible types

problem.fixMessage: Simple types ought to be compatible.
problem.message: The from-spec of simple type "<xs:simpleType "integer">" is not compatible with to-spec of simple type "<xs:simpleType "string">" - a BPEL runtime may provide an implicit conversion.
problem.ruleDescription: From and to spec must have compatible types

problem.fixMessage: Simple types ought to be compatible.
problem.message: The from-spec of simple type "<xs:simpleType "boolean">" is not compatible with to-spec of simple type "<xs:simpleType "NCName">" - a BPEL runtime may provide an implicit conversion.
problem.ruleDescription: From and to spec must have compatible types

problem.fixMessage: You need to move this <bpws:rethrow> activity to a fault handler.
problem.message: The <bpws:rethrow> activity named Unnamed must be in a fault handler.

problem.fixMessage: Check variable "output" declaration, check WSDL message "<message "SimpleRequestMessage">" declaration.
